abstract: An excerpt from “Hitting a Straight Lick with a Crooked Stick,” by Zora Neale Hurston
lead_paragraph: For instance, if a white person were halted on the streets of Orlando and told that Old Man Morgan, the excessively black Negro hoodoo man, can kill any person indicated and paid for, without ever leaving his house or even seeing his victim, he’d laugh in your face and walk away, wondering how long the Negro would wallow in ignorance and superstition. But no black person in a radius of twenty miles will smile, not much. They know.
